column4: I'm having a problem with a fresh install of 10.10 netbook remix: The sidebar and top panel don't show up properly. There is 'negative space' where they should be, but no graphics. Anyone here familiar with this issue?
I have the same issue with radeon
it is a bug
it could be a radeon card. There's an ATI sticker on teh computer, but 10.10 regular doesn't prompt for any special drivers, and looks fine.
na ATI is lame, I never had problems with other cards
since I have the ATI crad insinde my laptop compiz makes problems, I have font issues etc
but I don't want to use closed source drivers, nv was much better
Can I update the drivers at all, or is it a bust? Kind of weird, if I alt-tab, the graphics show up for a second.
I fixed it by installing fglrx, but still it is a bug
what about moving home, normally nothing breaks, just update it in fstab
thanks, I'm installing that now, hopefully it's a fix.
it does solve the problem at least it did over here, but still it is not a fix, it is a workaround
Yeah, it should work out of the box. Really I just wanted to try the new interface. 10.10 is running fine.
besides this netbook thing is beta status
so what exactly is flgrx or what ever that was?
the closed source graphic drivers from ati, what card do you have
I don't know what card I have, since 10.10 doesn't report it. Is there an easy way to check from the shell?
I figured I'd see an option for ATI drivers on the additional driver window, but it only came up with stuff for my wireless card.
lspci
what it does not exist ?
lol, I have debian and just thought damn they even removed that :)
I got that, thanks :) It reports back that it's an ATI SB600? <-never heard of that.
